author: radekkapka
content: On a more serious note, I would like to ask other teams if they noticed something fishy with submitting aggregation selection proofs on Hoodi (the Beacon API endpoint is https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator/publishAggregateAndProofsV2). Since March 27th Prysm has a bursts of context deadline errors in the validator client that causes failures in submitting selection proofs. It usually lasts for ~30 seconds and then resolves itself. There are no errors on the beacon node side. Initially I thought it might be because of very late blocks, but it did not happen on Holesky pre-Electra, which makes me think Prysm has an Electra bug. Are any other clients seeing this?

author: jgm
content:
Checking our hoodi nodes for submitting an aggregate attestation:

- prysm responds in <100ms usually, sometimes up to 300ms
- lighthouse responds in <100ms usually, sometimes up to 1s
- teku responds in <100ms usually, sometimes up to 600ms
- nimbus responds in <100ms usually, sometimes up to 1.5s

"usually" here means between 95% and 99.9% of all submissions, so it isn't something we're seeing on our servers as an issue.

author: radekkapka
content: If Vouch doesn't have any issues with Prysm (meaning the response success rate is 100%), then we have a bug in our VC

author: parithosh
content: The interop-testing call on monday falls on a public holiday in a lot of countries. Should we skip the call on Monday (21st Apr)?
